Job Title: Firmware Validation Technician

Location: Hillsboro, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Manufacturing

Description:
Who we are:At UST, we help the world’s best organizations grow and succeed through transformation. Bringing together the right talent, tools, and ideas, we work with our client to co-create lasting change. Together, with over 30,000 employees in 25 countries, we build for boundless impact—touching billions of lives in the process. Visit us at UST.com.
The Opportunity:As a Firmware Validation Technician, you will be part of a team engaged in the validation of BIOS/FW for Server/client PC products. You will execute cross component test cases and regression checks and file quality bugs within permissible limits of the program.
This is 100% onsite position, and you will be working in a lab located at a client site. 
Your job responsibilities include but not limited to:the FW features and the test cases to validate them Execution of test cases, provide the test results and report defects Prepare test systems (client & servers) by assembling the required hardware, flashing FW and installing OS Perform bug reproduction and fix verification activities.the assigned test grid without deviation from the given test stepsthe product failures and report it in test repository and bug trackerregression checkcross component executionthe expected behaviour of products across components
What we need:4+ year of experience in the following areas:of BIOS/FW/platform of Server/Client with x86 architecturefeaturestest cases (Understand, articulate and isolate the issues observed during test execution)and interfaces in a PC Client/server systemclient computer systembe working at client location in Hillsboro, there is no option for remote or Hybrid work
What we believe:We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone, to champion diversity and inclusion and to place people at the center of everything we do. 
Humility:We will listen, learn, be empathetic and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.Humanity:Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.Integrity:We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.
Equal Employment Opportunity StatementUST is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, or sexual orientation.All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, colour, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.UST reserves the right to periodically redefine your roles and responsibilities based on the requirements of the organization and/or your performance.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
